result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J. Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark J. Nelson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark J. Nelson was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May petition for early discharge after 6 months.

miscConds.notes: Subject to Work Release.  NOT Good Time.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Cannot vote until civil rights are restored.
Cannot hold public office.
Other rights may be lost until restored.
If not a US citizen, may face deportation or potential loss of other citizenship rights.
No illegal substances.  Subject to testing.

Must undergo COMPAS evaluation and follow through with criminogenic needs as recommended by Probation.
Must provide DNA sample.  NO surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Conditional time stayed/banked to be used by probation if necessary.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: and Order Allowing Defendant to Wear Street Clothes at Trial.  SIGNED 5/18/15.

CASES: 14CF441, 15CF8 & 15CF60. Defendant Mark J. Nelson in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Defendant Mark J. Nelson in custody.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 8:39 am.  
14CF441-Count 1-NC plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  Count 2 dismissed.  15CF8-dismissed. 15CF60-dismissed.  Def waives PSI.  CT finds not elig for CIP.  Elig for subst abuse pgm.  Not qualify for expungement.
SENTENCE:  w/h sentence, probation up to 1 yr.  May petition for early discharge after 6 mo.  COMPAS & follow recomm.  No illegal substances.  Subject to testing.  DNA sample, no surcharge.  Costs waived.  134 days sentence credit if revoked.  30 days CT, stayed/banked - subj to WR, no GT.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold public office, no body armor, other rights may be lost until restored.  If not US citizen face deportation or potential loss of other citizenship rights.  PCR.  9:06 am adj.
